basic_data.name: Town Crier Pub & Halfway Beer House

reviews.title: Terrible!
text: I was at the pub yesterday with 2 more friends because we love the selection of beers that they have. We asked to seat and the host point a table for us. The server was kind of rude talking to us when we asked for a few more minutes to decide what to drink. He never said good night or smile anytime talking with us. At the end of our night he just grabed my glass and walked away without even look at the table    After that we ask for the bill and payed for it. One of my friends was still finishing her drink when a lady showed up and asked us to leave. We didn't understand what was happening and she said that they have a reservation for that table at 10h45pm (and they had lots of tables free at the moment). We told her that we're finishing (was around 10h30) and she told us that we can finish inside if we wanted. We left, of course. It was rude, and at any moment they told us that they had a reservation. Again, lots of tables we're empty and even then she asked us to leave or go inside the pub. We went there a few times already and we're not going back after that.

reviews.title: Schnitzel and Beer
text: First place I went in Toronto and it was so good!! A very pub-y vibe, friendly staff, and wonderful selection of beer on draft.  I got the schnitzel and it was to die for.  Definitely recommend for anyone in Toronto

reviews.title: Great beer selection
text: Had some. Calamari and Belgium beer. Sat on the patio and it was a great place. Everything was good. It was a bit crowded with furniture on the patio but it was enjoyable.

reviews.title: Service needs overhauling!
text: Went with friends for dinner.  Menu appeared quickly, then we waited, and waited for 20 minutes before a waiter asked if we would like to order drinks.  We were also ready to order dinner after this long wait.
Food was good, but service was terrible.  Restaurant was not busy as it was early evening.  Would not go again.

reviews.title: Beer perfect, service need to improve
text: The German beer is extraordinary good but not cold enough, need to be. And when I order prezels and dips, I expect prezels and different dips, not half a plate of salad and tomato slices and only two prezels with cream cheese.  By the way the prezels were exactly like in Germany so why not putting one more on the plate and add swiss cheese and leave all the salad.

It would be nice if everybody could place the order right away without waiting ages while the staff is chatting in front of the waiting guests. Doesn't look good. A shower before starting work would be fine as well.

reviews.title: Great pub with great beer selection
text: Just what you would expect from a pub.  Nice atmosphere, lots of beers on tap.   There were 10 of us and we had reserved a table. Fun choice for a night out with friends

reviews.title: real nice place to visit for beer and food
text: Went to this place by chance walking on way to the theatre.  Great service .. Great food .. of course Great beer selection .. and most of all .. Great and fair pricing.  Very quiet and relaxing atmosphere ..  Definitely a place to re-visit on any future outings to the big city.

reviews.title: Great Beer Selection and Outdoor Seating
text: We stumbled upon this place while walking around exploring the city.  It seemed like a busy place so we thought we could give it a try.  We sat on the patio.  The tables were small but big enough for what we ordered.  The beer selection was amazing.  I had the chicken schnitzel and my husband had a sandwich and fries.  It was all very good.  This is good people watching location.  There are other restaurants nearby and an ice cream place called "Sweet Jesus."  It had a huge line!  We asked someone what it was for, they said ice cream.  Must be Great ice cream.  We didn't get to try it :(

reviews.title: Great Food on John Street
text: I found John street when returning to my hotel. it looked like it had potential to find a place to eat. i grabbed lunch at the Town Crier, they had a seafood pasta on as special that day. When the meal came it had lots of fish & it was a big meal&.I really enjoyed the meal, i started paying attention to the other meals being served and everything looked good.  They had a upper floor with seating & a bar. The day I was there only the downstairs section was open & they have a few tables outside. They have a very small washroom for a good sized restaurant  & the toilet seat  was very loose & nearly falling off. They had lots of European beers, I only noticed a few Ontario beers on the menu.

reviews.title: Best beer selection
text: We stumbled across this amazing place while looking for somewhere to have a drink before going to a show. Our first visit we just had a couple of drinks (hard to choose from the selection) . Thanks to a great knowledgeable barman Ian we stayed for a drink and good conversation with him. 2or 3 weeks later we went back, Ian remembered us straight away. This time we stayed for dinner. Food was excellent !!!!
Service is good even when busy .
Great atmosphere
Will go back for sure

reviews.title: Great crowded, lively pub
text: We got the last table on a very busy Friday night, the Town Crier was loud, crowded, and extremely lively and we loved it. The beer selection is huge with lots of European choices. The food was good and despite the crowds the wait staff were very friendly and efficient. We were upstairs but downstairs looked to be more interestingly decorated. The tables are really packed in but again you don't feel too cramped. If you like a great lively atmosphere, the Town Crier is a good choice.

reviews.title: Great pub experience, good beer selection, did no disappoint !
text: Went with friends who recommended. Did not disappoint.  Enjoyed the beer selection. Food was high quality, ample serving and tasty.  Would ask them to consider adding beer flight as an option so I could try more types of beer.   Service was fine. They serve good old fashioned pub food but I had lamb shank that was excellent. Also at our table was sausage and yeager schnitzel. Not much left on plates
Ask to be seated upstairs if you want a bit of quieter and out of drafts from door.
I plan to take my twenty something children some say. They will like it too. (Especially the beer).

reviews.title: Great beer selection!
text: Over 50 beers on tap.  Nice cozy spot that didn't seem as touristy as most of the places on the same street.  Just went in for a quick drink before a movie but will be going here again when I have more time

reviews.title: Incredible selection of beers
text: Great selection of beers and a set of very knowledgeable staff who helped us decide the right beers for our tastes. Brilliant atmosphere and was the highlight of our bar visits all night

reviews.title: A beer lover's dream
text: I was walking by with a friend looking for dinner and decided to try out Town Crier which boasted 50 beer on tap, and it didn't disappoint; the beer menu was thicker than the food menu. They do have a wine list as well. Food was good and decently priced with a fair amount of vegetarian items. Service was polite and prompt. The space is cozy as tables are very close together but the decor is beautiful! I didn't venture upstairs but it looked like a room that could be rented out for functions? It was a very mixed group of people, businessmen, couples, groups of friends. This place seems to have something for everyone.

reviews.title: Great Lunch Spot
text: I came to this spot with my girlfriend and buddy from back home. I ordered some great beers from the tap and they were awesome. We ordered the specials and they were first rate and tasted really good. The service was excellent the server even fixed my wobbly table. We sat on the patio and had a great view of the street as the people walked by.

reviews.title: Good pub
text: I'm not a huge beer fanatic but they have an enormous selection.  Nice patio.  Friendly service.  Great location to bar hop.

reviews.title: An Entire Book of Beer!
text: You can choose from several beers on tap, although they did not have my favorite German beer. Mainly German cuisine, which was delicious!

reviews.title: Lovely pub!
text: During a recent Toronto visit, I enjoyed some time at the Town Crier Pub & Halfway Beer House which is located on the splendid John Street. This is yet another great pub housed in a really beautiful building found in the Entertainment District.
Great staff, good service, excellent drinks & a lovely outside seating area all made for a wonderful pub experience. Recommended!

reviews.title: Great Pub
text: I finally made it to Town Crier and it was a great evening. They nearly have 50 micro brews on tap, great selection of premium top self liquor. Ambiance is great and has two floor of dining and it tends to get busy early evening and then tapers down. Excellent food menu to choose from and prices are well matched. You will not be disappointed as staff is friendly and eager to help -
